body:
### Context

Inside time consuming operations, that take place reiteratively for a prolonged time, we are not flushing to db on every new record or state update (avoiding single disk write operations and batching them instead).
For instance:
1) When the wallet scans the chain (during sync or rescan), looking for new "own" transactions.
2) When the wallet is being loaded; which, in case of having conflicting transactions, requires to update the tx and its descendants states.

### Main Problem

We are actually flushing to db directly, no batching, on both processes under some circumstances:

- For the chain synchronization/rescan process:
    - We are flushing to db every time that the process founds an output, that belongs to the wallet, when it address is not inside the address book.â¨

- For the transactions loading process:
    - We are flushing to db every time that we update the spent outputs map, to unlock the coin, and when the transaction being loaded conflicts with another transaction.

### Extra Problem

- In several places across the wallet flows, we create new `WalletBatch` objects. Which, internally, mean:

    1. Increase the db references number and try to open the db.
    2. And a disk read operation of the âversionâ field.

 	For example, along `AddToWalletIfInvolvingMe`, a new `WalletBatch` object is internally created every time that `MarkConflicted`, `SetAddressBook` and `AddToWallet` are called.

### Conclusion

This should bring us a good speedup of the wallet synchronization, rescan and load processes.
title: wallet: speedup transactions sync, rescan and load not flushing to db constantly
